intro: Phyllostegia leptostachya, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed strobilanthes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lamiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and unique floral structure, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
